result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court
Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Passionelle S Sims

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the victim B.S and A.S (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant my take medications that are prescribed for mental health purposes.

1:32 PM Defendant Passionelle S Sims appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Ramirez appeared by video for Passionelle S Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant 
Defendant states she was having child care issues and that is why she missed court.
Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on February 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
In Custody - RCJ

9:15 AM Defendant Passionelle S Sims not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sean P Riordan in court for Passionelle S Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft is unable to be brought down to court this morning due to some issues.
BTC: Matter set over to tomorrow in intake court, matter adjourned.
Return on warrant scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:48 PM Defendant Passionelle S Sims not in court.  Attorney Sean P Riordan in court for Passionelle S Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft missed court on 8-23-22.
BTC: Bond forfeiture hearing held - forfeiture granted. - stay 48 hrs.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $2000 sig bond; missed hrg 8-23-22
Warrant/capias/commitment entered into all three systems and forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

9:02 AM Defendant Passionelle S Sims not in court.  Attorney Sean P Riordan in court for Passionelle S Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
RCAP has filed a violation report on 7-21-22.
Deft does not appear.
Defense has not had any contact with the deft.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 24 hrs.
from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

8:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Passionelle S Sims in court.  Attorney Sean P Riordan in court for Passionelle S Sims. Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider. 
Defense needs an offer.
Defense is requesting another status date.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the victim B.S and A.S (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant my take medications that are prescribed for mental health purposes.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Passionelle S Sims appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Passionelle S Sims. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
